author: Tejal Raval
text: 'My family and I came for Diwali lunch and everything was just wonderful! The food was fresh and delicious! The warm hospitality of the staff was just great! Definitely a place to check out in Hoboken!'

author: Shikshya Gurung
text: 'Wonderful Place with Tasty food itemsüòç'

author: Api&Astit gurung
text: 'Best place with delicious foodüòç'

author: Tom P
text:
'Ordered food 2:30 hours ago and still isn‚Äôt ready.  Not even sure why they‚Äôd take orders if they can‚Äôt fill them.  Never ordering or going there again.

Also tried calling after an hour and they said they were preparing the food.  Tried calling back and they‚Äôd answer then not say anything while keeping the phone online to be busy.

My biggest issue is that they weren‚Äôt honest when they picked up the phone as we would‚Äôve made other plans if we knew it‚Äôd end up being 3 hours.'

author: Atharv Gosavi
text: 'The service sucks a lot. For one beer to serve they took 1 hr. We had placed the order at 8:50pm and the waitress came to ask at 9:45pm  for our order
column5: however we had placed the order long back. Never order paneer chili as it‚Äôs not paneer it‚Äôs just rubber. When we asked about why everything is so late the manager and the waitress started giving us rude looks. So far it is the worst service I have ever had in any Indian Cuisine restaurant in entire US. I‚Äôm sitting in restaurant and still waiting for rest of my order and it‚Äôs 10:30pm.'

author: EZ NZ
text: '2.5hrs and food not even ready for delivery driver to pick up. Order at your own risk.'

author: Mo Sekhon
text: "Awful experience. Ordered over two hours ago and they still have not got the food ready to be delivered. It is fine to be busy but to not update the wait time online is wrong. I looked on UberEATS again to see if this has since been changed but no it has not
column5: it still states 45mins. You can't call either as they have clearly disengaged their line to show as busy. Terrible service."

author: Gopal Agarwal
text: 'Good food. Appetizer (Gobi 65
column5: paneer tikka) were great
column6: main course was okay-ish.\nHas a lot of jain options.'

author: kishan smith
text: 'Really good restaurant in Hoboken
column5: I went their with 12 friends on my birthday and the service was amazing and food was great. If you are looking for real Indian taste  must visit here
column6: also their momo‚Äôs were really good
column7: must try Strongly recommended.'

author: PRANAI RAI
text: 'We were exhausted the whole day after home inspection ! Was looking for good  soul- food place to eat ~~  MY God finding a needle in a Haystack was this Indian cuisine.What a find !!!!   Hell Yeah. It was about late afternoon 3P. and the staff was in a break
column5: the manager in the house  was kind enough to accommodate us.  Long story short- food was incredible
column6: great selections and nice vibe. Thank god they had MOMO and chutney :).  Kasto din ma ayechau. Dhunga khojda- deuta bheteko !!!  Good job Team. I totally recommend this place.'

author: Ismael Boussatta
text: 'Delicious food. Excellent service. Great ambiance.'

author: Roshni Agarwal
text: 'This is at a stone throw away distance from the Hoboken path station. We tried samosa chat
column5: Empyrean mix grill
column6: chicken curry and mutton biryani and a few drinks.. The food was really good. Recommend the place for trying out Indian food'

author: totof z
text: 'Best Indian food around! I particularly like the butter chicken and the chicken curry.\nNice generous portions with plenty of sauce.\nGreat garlic naan!'

author: Ekta Chordia
text: 'We ordered Chilli Paneer as Starter. But it was highly spicy. And the Drink Old Fashioned was all Sweet. Poor Dining Experience. Talking about Entrees
column5: it took quite long time to serve Main'

author: Abhishek Nandi
text: 'The best Indian restaurant of NY is on this side of Hudson ;)\n\nService - Managed by a seasoned Mr Rana and an excellent crew
column5: we felt as if we are dining out with our friends.\nDining in or takeout
column6:
the service is top notch.

Food - Mmmmmmm
Momos - Must have! They have an expansive menu but this is possibly their bestseller.

Sizzling platters - We have tried both the Paneer Tikka and Chicken/Fish combination and both are highly recommended. Very well marinated and cooked to perfection.

Definitely my fav Indian restaurant in and around NYC/Jersey City. All the best guys!!'

author: Keerthi Sravan Ravi (K3)
text: '- Friendly staff\n- Outdoor seating was pleasant\n- Tomato soup was tasty! BUT was strong on the colouring agents
column5: watch out stained tongues haha\n- Fried paneer momos and chili garlic naan are great\n- Affordable'

author: Sanga Agrawal
text: "Loved the cocktails! You have to try jaljira cocktail
column5:
it's tasty and boozy forward.
The Momo's were good too. I also tried paneer pakodas which I'd say were average.

I'd say the management at the place could be better
column6: I appreciate being asked about my experience but not 7 times in 2 hours. Also I was asked about what I wanted to order 3 times within 5 minutes of sitting down by different servers.\nIt's not a deal breaker
column7: but just a genuine good hearted feedback. Would definitely be going back here!"

author: Talal Waheed
text: 'Without a doubt. This is the best Indian restaurant in NY/NJ. Have tried all overrated Indian restaurants in Manhattan and jersey but the food here is just amazing. Also I have never seen such a great customer service in an Indian restaurant. Big thanks to Mamta and Sushma for their awesomeness.'

author: kmatlock
text: 'This place is a MUST DO!!! The food is so fresh. I especially loved all the spicy dishes! Not to mention the service was OUTSTANDING!'

author: Amey Phatak
text: 'A late night dinner hunt and then you arrive at the right place to satisfy your hunger. This Indian kitchen is delicious with fine cocktails. I always have a habit of ordering the cocktail with the weirdest name and this time it was ‚ÄúThe Gujju Misunderstood Smash‚Äù. If you‚Äôre a whiskey lover then this one is the drink for you with a hint of ginger
column5: fresh mint and cucumber. My friend ordered ‚ÄúSomrus mango martini‚Äù. A drink with its own taste
column6: not a fan but it was okay! Coming to appetizers
column7: ordered delicious steamed veg momos. Try this for sure if you‚Äôre visiting this kitchen. For the main course ordered Tandoori roti and Paneer Kaju Makhani. Tried this combination for the first time and it was tasty. If you‚Äôll order medium it will be a bit sweeter however
column8: you can go for the spicy one. The rice is provided on the side with curry!\n\nThe ambience is perfect. Service was excellent and friendly. They make sure you get what you like and keeps on checking with you in case you‚Äôve issues with the food or need anything else. Thank you for the hospitality. Kudos to the cooks for serving the delicious food!'

author: Sukriti Vaish
text: 'Worst food ever! Dn go!'

author: Dipen Luitel
text: 'Best place in Hoboken to have Asian/ Indian and Nepali food. Loved the indor and outdoor setup. Wonderful hospitality from the staffs. Thumps up!!!'

author: Dawa finju sherpa
text: 'One of the best samosas I have ever had. Also the Momo there is true loveüòçüòç. Overall I really enjoyed the food and the vibe.'

author: Rinxhen Pasang
text: 'best dumpling ü•ü'

author: Bimesh De Silva
text: 'The lamb curry + rice was excellent. I wish it came with some vegetables to go along with it though. Everyone was kind and friendly.'

author: Nilesh Shukla
text: 'Delicious Indian food loved it :)'

author: Lakeram Kissoon
text: 'Food was good and so was the service.'

author: Namrata Ray
text: 'Food was delicious. Ambience was awesome. Food quality and quantity both are way better than other restaurants in neighborhood. The owner was there and made my aunt‚Äôs birthday celebration memorable and special with their mouth watering carrot halwa cake.'

author: Nishant kadu
text: "Best Baingan bharta. Even if you don't like baingan do try it."

author: Doug Oberfield
text: 'By far the best Indian food around. They have a great variety in their menu
column5: and everything we have tried there has been outstanding! The lamb roganjosh is awesome!!'

author: Vivek Trivedi
text:
'My rating: 4.2 / 5

Good food and few unique items on the menu which are not very common in the menu of Indian restaurants around here.

1) Bhindi masala: 5/5 Great sabzi
column5:
very authentic recipe.
2) Empyrean chicken curry: 3/5 Nothing special even though it is supposed to be special because it‚Äôs cooked in wine and has mushrooms. :/ The biggest complaint I had was the quality of chicken in this which was dry (perhaps overcooked) and bland.
3) Fried paneer momos: 5/5 Crunchy and tasty momos. They forgot to give us sauce for it so I had to make my own special momos sauce at home which was not an issue.
4) Garlic naan: 4/5 Good old garlic naan.
5) Lachcha paratha: 4/5 Good but nothing extraordinary.'

author: Nishank Varshney
text: 'Really loved all our food here! The service was awesome - our servers Sushma
column5: Mamta
column6: and Sanjay gave helpful recommendations on what to order! Must try the Chili Tawa Paneer if you‚Äôre here'

author: Sukanya Rangarajan
text:
'I went in for momos and stayed for the drinks.
Amazing experience. The food was good and the drinks were even better.
Drinks that I‚Äôd def recommend -
Jaljeera martini
Mango Margherita
Bombay Mule
Mango Martini'

author: kunal bavishi
text: 'Really bad food!!!'

author: liz gosselin
text: "Simply deliah. The best Indian restaurant I've been to so far!"

author: Poonam Kripalani
text: 'Food was amazing specially Momos . Drink was great. And staff was very friendly. We will be back soon.'

author: Ian
text: 'Great food and ambience.'

author: Edward Reep
text: "The food is top-notch
column5: and they serve delicious drinks as well! We had an extremely delicious Chicken Tikka Masala and Cheese Naan! Good ambiance. This is my go-to now!\n\nThe Indian food is as good as they have in Jersey City but in Hoboken! We don't have to Uber or take the PATH to Exchange Place or Journal Square now for food like this!"

author: sahil popli
text: 'Underwhelming at best'

author: Mohit Shetty
text: 'This is definitely a must try if you‚Äôre looking for good authentic Indian food in Jersey City. The drinks are unique and interesting. We have had the Butter Chicken quite a few times here and would definitely recommend it. The staff is well organized and Mamata was brilliant as always!'

author: Abhay Shah
text: 'I recently moved to the area and have already come here several times. Food is amazing and staff is super nice and friendly. Mamta and Sanjay remember what I like. Highly recommend.'

author: Sourabh Ajmera
text:
"It's a newly opened restaurant in Jersey City.

Food:
The best Indian food in jersey city area. All other restaurants are don't even come close when it's about food (taste and quality). This restaurant is definitely at the level of one of the top Indian restaurant you could find in NYC. I like all their dishes in the list but do order momos
column5:
my favorite appetizer.

Drinks:
Restaurant is still experimenting with drinks so it's hit and miss sometimes. They haven't nailed down their cocktails list. So if you are particular about your drink
column6:
I would say stick to beer and wine.

Ambience:
I would say the ambience is pretty good inside and outside. This not being an expensive restaurant it's still gives you a vibe of being in a nice cozy place to have a dinner with your SO or friends and family.

Commute/Parking:
Restaurant is located right outside Hoboken path which it a very easy commute for locals but the restaurant doesn't provide parking. So if you would like to drive here you would have to look for street parking and I mean really look for it over the weekends as the area is always packed.

Cheers!"

author: Shamsher Sachdeva
text: 'Excellent food. I love their lamb vindaloo.'

author: ambika barathi
text: 'Had a great experience in Empyrean Indian Kitchen!! Amazing people and great customer service. Paneer Fried Momos and Mashroom Tikka were really good!! Special mention to Mamtha and Sushma
column5: who were wonderful and good in customer service which is one of the best qualities that people should posses in this industry.'

author: Sudeep Mallik
text: 'Great food
column5: cocktails and friendly staff.'

author: Suchi Jain
text: "have been here thrice & will be definitely going back more frequently! We had Khoya Kaju
column5: Paneer
column6: Momos
column7: Saam Savera
column8: Methi Malai mutter - everything was delectable. Their staff members are so welcoming & caring. Rana
column9: the Empyrean's manager is really nice
column10: friendly & made sure we had perfect experience as I was with 2 little girls. Their drinks & deserts options are great & very interesting. My friends & family loved everything whatever we ordered. In addition to it
column11: love the ambiance & enjoy outdoor dining. I have also ordered online & the experience has been flawless."

author: Nidhi Thakur
text: 'Yesterday I went to this restaurant with my husband and it was a great experience and the location was perfect. Mr. Rana the manager made our drinks and it was splendid. The food was taking a little time to come out
column5: but other than that I loved it. 10/10 recommend and will definitely be going back.'

author: Anitha Jose
text: "I had a really nice time at Empyrean Indian Kitchen. The restaurant has pretty interiors. The food was delicious
column5: the drinks were refreshing. What stood out was the excellent service by Mamtha and Sushma. They were attentive
column6: sweet and knowledgeable about the entire menu.\nThe chicken 65
column7: chicken momos
column8: rasmalai and gulab jamun were my favorites and we'll definitely be coming back for more!"

author: Reginald George
text: 'I enjoyed the food and drinks at the Empyrean Indian Kitchen and bar.  A shout out to both Sushma and Mamata for their phenomenal customer service! They were pleasant
column5: very courteous and kept on checking on our group to make sure that everything was fine.The steamed chicken momos were delicious!'

author: Sriya G
text: 'I am from New York and there‚Äôs plenty of restaurants for Nepalese momos in the city so I was definitely happy to find one restaurant here in jersey city that had momos. It was definitely one of the best chicken momo I had outside of new york but veg momo wasn‚Äôt the best. I heard paneer momo was also little dry.\nTheir service was the best though. I ordered chicken curry and it ended up being little spicy and the waitress who was serving me took it back and asked them to make it less spicy and brought it back fresh for me.\n+5 star for their service but had to give 4 for the momos.'

author: Gayatri Somwanshi
text: 'I don‚Äôt understand where should I start. About the service.. they‚Äôll make you wait for almost everything from refilling water to take orders. We had to wait for everything and the wait isn‚Äôt worth while. There was too much kasoori methi in both the curries that we ordered and we had to remind the server for our food. And when we asked for a special request in a soup as my friend is allergic to pepper and tomato
column5: the server didn‚Äôt understand it I guess and rudely asked us to order something else. Even we had to wait and ask 2-3 times for the drinks that we had ordered. The only better part were momos. I wouldn‚Äôt suggest this restaurant to anyone that I know.'

author: Daveed Silva
text: 'by far one of the best restaurants in the area
column5: for takeout
column6: or in person
column7: the foood is super amazing and the service is top top'

author: Abhi Shake
text: 'Smoky interiors. Bad smell at the entrance. Leaky roof spewing water containing god knows what and the worst of all is a random inexplicable loud karoake event that was setup inside... The food was decent but the wait time was too long.\nHighly recommend to skip'

author: V Kingpin
text: 'Love this place! The location is fantastic
column5: just steps from the Hoboken PATH. The food is awesome
column6: especially their Momos
column7: Tikka Masala and Saag (which they have tofu options for) and the service and ambience are also great.\n\nWe got to know Kiro well and he‚Äôs super friendly and gives us great recommendations on the menu. Rana is the manager and he is very attentive and kind. They both take great care of us. I highly recommend this place!'

author: Sneh Shah
text: 'Rarely do we find a good Indian restaurant around Hoboken (of course not jersey city).\n\nThe food was really good and the service topped everything for us. Great ambiance
column5: lovely lightning.\n\nWould definitely go again.'

author: Khushal Vora
text:
'Amazing...
Best Momos in US.
Food was extremely delicious..
Best Indian restaurant in hoboken area.'

author: Gagan S
text: 'The peanut chaat is amazing!'

author: Tina Agarwal
text: 'Do yourself a favor and visit this lovely restaurant in Hoboken.The service is unmatched.Mr Rana (the manager) is very helpful
column5: highly professional. Extremely impressed by him. The food is absolutely amazing
column6: chicken and momoes are best.Absolutely the best meal we had in a while. Highly recommend!'

author: Ruben Bohorquez
text: "It's a place that keeps the tuning in all the things that project to the clients. The restaurant have a nice ambient
column5: cool music and tigh design
column6: that makes you feel very comfortable. Although the menu is very tough to understand (more because the Indian language)
column7: the waiters helps to you to understand all the options they have. And of course
column8: the food was amazing
column10: the lamb and the perfect bread."

author: Nidhi Singh
text: 'Good food and professional staff'

author: Ra Dhe
text: "Very well customers service by Mr. Rana (manager) & his crew (from starting to end ) My mom doesn't eat onion & garlic so it's hard to find place where she can enjoy food with us So my brother called @ the place &
column5: The way Manager responded us on phone I feel so positive to go there!! We really enjoyed food there and hospitality! Perfect place for the spicy food lovers!! No worries if you don't eat spicy they will cook for you with less spices. We have ordered so many different dishes my favorite dish was fried mamos!!!   Keep it up good work üëåüëçü§©"

author: Somanath Tripathy
text: "Nice vibe for dine-in
column5: but the food was meh - 3 stars max. I ordered a Rogan Josh and it tasted so sweet. Every Indian curry was sweet
column6: regardless of what it was. Food was definitely on the expensive side
column7: but was aromatic and looked premium when served in brass containers - guess you're paying for the ambience. If you're planning to sit outside under the temporary structure
column8: it's probably not worth it. Overall 3.5 stars."

author: Chirayu Shah
text: 'Amazing spot! Staff is VERY polite
column5: service is relatively quick I‚Äôd say
column6: seating locations are nice
column7: and an overall amazing experience. Loved going there. Try the Jal Jeera margarita. We had Jain food (no onion
column8: no garlic) and they made fresh
column9: fire food quickly. Big fan and definitely going to be a recurring customer!'

author: Megan Voorhees
text: 'One of the best restaurants Hoboken has to offer! Service is consistent and thoughtful. Our group actually got trapped by the rain after our meal
column5: and our server offered her own umbrella to us so we wouldn‚Äôt get soaked walking home. Drinks are well crafted - the Delhi spiced mojito is amazing! Garlic tikka
column6: steamed chicken momos
column7: and garlic naan are a must
column8: but honestly everything on the menu is delicious. Can‚Äôt wait to come back!'

author: Aditya Badhwar
text: 'Awesome place
column5: great hospitality ...Mamta/Sushma were great host/servers ..when asked to customize food
column6: they happily asked chef and thanks to chef for adding garlic to lacha prantha ....'

author: apurva abhyankar
text: 'Great food. Do try the lamb Rogan josh.'

author: Sapan Patel
text: 'If you finally want indian food that is not adulterated
column5: this is the place to go! From their extensive menu that cater to both veg and non veg
column6: and their service
column7: everything is excellent! A must visit place!'

author: Karan Puri
text: 'Food and service was really good!'

author: DK
text: 'Just discovered this place through friends as we had  never heard about it . Good food need some changes in few dishes need to work on that other then that tandoori dishes were good noodles were good tamarind margarita was yummy .Punjabi dishes need some tweaking as it‚Äôs new Will give them a chance and will come back again . Would recommend it'

author: Aakriti Mahajan
text: 'So. Good. A more upscale Indian food place with Indian influenced cocktails. Paneer momos were amazing as was the cauliflower 64 ! (We also got the lo mein and chicken vindaloo which were se looks as well). Nice staff and chef
column5: we asked foe extra crispy cauliflower and spicy and they delivered !  We had plenty left over for leftovers as well'

author: vinamra jain
text: "The service staff was really great. Our get together continued for little longer than we expected but the staff was very patient and gave a very good service. We choose to sit outside and it was just wonderful. We didn't have to wait too long for food and drinks. Now going to the food part. After such a long time
column5: i could find a nice indian food. The taste was authentic and delicious. They have a great selection on the Menu. Overall
column6: I would definitely recommend this place and thanks to the whole staff for an amazing evening. Food + Ambience + Service = perfect combination."

author: Malia Kar
text: 'Mamta and sushma are amazing!! Thank you for singing ‚ÄúHappy Birthday‚Äù to my friend!!! We absolutely love how friendly they are. Here you feel like family. Highly recommend this place. The food is also *chef kiss* delicious. #foreveracustomer'

author: Nicholas Leyden-Morffi
text: 'Excellent service
column5: delicious food
column6: great ambience. All the staff are very attentive. Highly recommend this place.'

author: Dr4gon
text: "Amazing food
column5: vibes and service! Esp Kero (He's a magicians with drinks)
column6: He makes some deliciously tempting remixed cocktails
column7: perfect for your indian palate. Very sweet and warm service from Mamta and Sushma. I always come back to this spot."

author: Sanket Pednekar
text: 'Food was not at all that great. We ordered Chicken Steamed Momos and Reshmi Kebab for appetizers and
column5: Chicken Madras Curry and Goat Masala for main course. Momos were amazing but rest everything were not that good. Both the curries had a creamier texture which is unlikely to see in any Madras curry. The cocktails were good but lacked proper description in the menu. Our server was very good. Probably the 3 stars are for her service and the momos.'

author: Paul Naraine
text: 'My wife and I went last night for a late dinner.  The manager was outstanding.  The food was delicious; came out in steaming platter and the lamb was tender.  Wife enjoyed the tandoori chicken and chef even gave us a sample dish from the kitchen.  Later in the night they had a dance floor and local DJ.  Overall we had a great first experience and will be visiting again very soon.  Thank you for a splendid date night.'

author: Bhaumil-Ladku Patel
text: 'Great food. Great service'

author: maryam medhat
text: 'Highly recommended!! Rana the manager was very helpful'

author: Mena Hemaia (Menatcp)
text: 'Me and our friend visit the Restaurant  and the food  was perfect and food amazing specially staff
column5: Kiro was amazing very friendly  and  i will come again  for food and kiro'

author: Abhi S
text: 'Amazing place! Great choice of specialty drinks
column5: the food was delicious - Paneer Momos üòã üòã and the staff was amazing very friendly and responsive. Service was great all the food was hot and right on time.  l am definitely coming back to eat here... üòã'

author: Shashank Singhal
text: "3 stars for the ambience and service. Really friendly staff and great ambience.. this could definitely be the upsalcale Indian restaurant that Jersey City needs.\nBut the food is disappointing. We ordered the Paneer Tikka masala and it was bad
column5: like really bad. The chef and staff were kind enough to offer us a free change
column6: but it didn't make much of a difference.\nThe breads were really good and having vegan Indian options is a big plus!\nThis could definitely become a 5 star restaurant that pulls crowds soon."

author: Jay
text: 'Had dinner there on Sunday with a friend from Rajasthan who now lives in Jersey City. Really pleased in every way.The staff
column5: service and food were tops.Walked across the street and caught the train back home after dinner.'

author: Matt Lamont
text: 'My wife and I went there for lunch on Saturday.   Nice restaurant
column5: really friendly staff
column6: plenty of outdoor seating
column7: and delicious food.  We split an order of samosas for an appetizer.  The samosas a huge and delicious.  My wife had the vegetarian korma and I had the lamb Tikka kabab.  Both were very flavorful and good sized portions.  We had plenty of leftovers for dinner later that night.  I highly recommend eating here.'

author: Jimmy Shah
text: 'Loved their Gobi Manchurian'

author: Gayithri J
text: 'We had a good time both with food and drinks. Mamta was great at serving us and checking on us :)'

author: premal patel
text: 'I would give Empyrean Indian Kitchen 10 stars if I could! Excellent ambience
column5: food and service. We stopped by this restaurant with my family and we are all super impressed. We have ordered several dishes to be shared amongst all of us and none of them disappointed. We ordered momos for an appetizer. It was just the right combination of crispy and taste was amazing. Served with homemade chutneys
column6: amazingly good.\nService here is reliably terrific. Smiling  and friendly
column7: efficient and helpful too.\nMust visit place in Hoboken!'

author: Chetana Bayas
text: 'We enjoyed celebrating our friends reception at the Bar. The owner was very sweet and professional. Their team were warm and attentive to the party. We enjoyed our dinner at their place.'

author: Parul Sharma
text: 'This Saturday  I came here with my wife and with my in-laws
column5: and Absolutely loved this place! The food was bursting with flavor and the service was impeccable. Drinks were awesome. I will definitely be coming back!!!'

author: Yash Mahendra
text: 'One of the best Indian food I had in NJ. Keep it up.'

author: RIKHIL GANDHI
text: 'Good food. Jain food option available but try to be specific about your order. We ordered Jain food for 2 people - Gobi manchurian
column5: paneer makhani(gravy)
column6: paneer kadhai(dry)
column7: tandoori roti. Papad and rice was complimentry. Sabzi bowl size are attached for reference.'

author: Girish Chopra
text: 'Nice place right near the waterfront. Have outdoor seating as well. Nice ambience. The quantity and quality of food is good. A must try place.'

author: Edgar Montes
text: 'The staff is too slow it took me an hour get my food even though nobody was there also the order was placed  hour and a half'

author: Avraham Sherman
text: 'Great food
column5: great service
column6: great place. Do recommend!'

author: Bryanah Hughes
text: 'My first time here and the food was so delicious and the staff and owner were so friendly
column5: excellent service. Definitely coming back :)'

author: Paresh Soni
text: 'Excellent food and service. Very friendly staff. We will definitely visit again and recommend to try.'

author: Tonmoy Bhagawati
text: "We had a wonderfully refreshing evening at Empyrean.\nWe were seated at the outdoor seating area
column5: and it was well placed right outside the reataurant.\nThe servers were present almost all the time
column6: courteous and masked.\nThe dinner main course was well cooked and tasty
column7: but the appetizers stole the show. Very tasty with just the right spice levels.\nThey have a well stocked bar
column8: and you definitely ought to try the beers TajMahal and Bira.\nRestroom was easily accessible and clean
column9: and it was a delight to see the restroom sign say 'All gender restroom' .\nI would love to visit again."

author: Joseph Brown
text: 'Very pleased with the dining experience. Food is very
column5: very good and the owner is very engaged. Staff provided solid service.'

author: Dristi Ghimire
text: 'THE BEST Nepalese and Indian cuisine that i have ever had...the ambience is amazing...Vegetable Mo:Mo is mind blowing...you must have to taste it once in your lifetime...I have never had Veggie Mo:Mo this good ever even when I make at home...the staff is super friendly and they do care about their customers...if you are travelling to New Jersey or New York please do not miss out...you have to go and eat here...must go restaurants with such a reasonable price...right off Path train in Hoboken
column5: NJ...I came all the way from Pennsylvania and oh boy it was sooooo good...definitely coming back soon...HIGHLY recommend ‚ù§‚ù§‚ù§.'

author: Raghav Dave
text: 'Very good food lot of choices
column5: excellent quality and quantity. Spicy as well.'

author: Abhimanyu Gupta
text: 'Amazing addition to the culinary scene of Hoboken and Jersey city. There is a great menu of Indian inspired cocktails that are must try.\n\nService is fast
column5: food is delicious and portions are very generous. Must visit for all Indian food lovers.'

author: Akanksha Bansal
text: 'Service is great. Food is good. But the chef uses too much garam masala in pretty much everything.\nWill for sure day that this place had the best garlic nan I have ever had.'

author: Dean
text: 'A new restaurant that will surely be here to stay.  The drinks had no right to be that good
column5: and the food was spiced to perfection.  On top of that
column6: the service was incredible.  A staff that always made sure we were taken care of and were consistently readily available. 11/10 will come back.'

author: Yish Lim
text: 'Incredible food and drinks
column5: lovely staff.'

author: Deepal Patel
text: 'We have been there couple of times. The food is good. However
column5: for some of the apps I feel they use the same sauce
column6: but
column7: that still was delicious. I‚Äôd love to try other items here. Definitely recommend!'

author: Ujjval Thakkar
text: "I went in here with my wife expecting to have good Indo-Chinese food. We ordered Fried Veg Momo
column5: Veg Chow Mein and Sweet Lassi. After tasting it
column6: we felt this place was like a fusion of different cuisines. Like it was not the authentic indo-chinese taste. At first
column7: we didn't like it
column8: but with time
column9: I started liking it.\n\n1. Fried Veg Momo - Were good
column10: the sauce was not. We mentioned something was off about the sauce to the waitress and she did go ahead and check it for us with the chef. They did find something off there. It was great of them to acknowledge it.\n2. Veg Chow Mein - Was good
column12: not authentic indo-chinese. Grows on you.\nNote to restaurant: If you are reading this
column14: no broccoli and cauliflower in the veg chow mein
column15: a big NO.\n3. Sweet Lassi - Was good
column16: not cold though.\n\nThe waitress was super courteous
column17: did check upon us regularly and was open to constructive feedback. She did mention they were new and are looking to improve."

author: Suraj Fale
text: 'We read so many good reviews about this place and visited here last sunday. Read so much about their Momos so ordered steamed and fried momos. We found fried momos were all stale and very bad in taste so we thought may be steamed momos will be good. It was all same and everything was so sour and stale. Still we thoughts lets order Main course it might be better but we were already so disappointed with our Momos. We ordered Biryani and 2 curries. Biryani was fine and again curries we found so sour. So much disappointment with the food. Service was worst. There were only 2 tables occupied that day still no one was responding to us. We asked change of plates after bad momos experience. They didnt change the plates. Almost for half of the time
column5: we were eating in dark as we misunderstood it as the theme of the restaurant but they switched on the lights after restaurant was full. Overall very much disappointed for such a pricy food.  Never going to forget this experience. 1 star i added for their cocktails'

author: Matthew McKeon
text: 'Food is delicious!'

author: Christian Sawoszczyk
text: 'I‚Äôve been here several times and last night was the third time my to go food has taken double the time they told me. They told me 15-20minutes for Chicken Tikka Masala and Hummus with Naan
column5: after 40 minutes I just walked out. I had to catch a train
column6: a women was supposedly checking on it but never came back after 10minutes.\nIt‚Äôs a shame because their food is delicious
column7: but the time it takes to get it is outrageous. I kept giving them 2 more minutes until I had almost no time to get to the train. It was a $32 lesson
column8: and I won‚Äôt be back.'

author: Lise Reynaud
text: 'Best Indian in town!!\nDelicious food
column5: plenty of vegetarian options
column6: staff is super nice and nice decoration inside. Truly a 5 star restaurant!'

author: ylias
text: 'Best Indian restaurant in town! Great place

column6: one of the best Indian dish I had so far. The mango lassi is absolutely delicious as well.\n\n+ the staff is very professional and always friendly. Don‚Äôt miss this place!'

author: crescent bardeskar
text: 'Amazing place! The food was soo good. They stayed even after closing cuz we weren‚Äôt done. The owner and all the employees were super good!'

author: Kunal M
text: 'This is Hoboken‚Äôs fourth Indian restaurant but by far the best. It is relatively new
column5: but if they sustain their food quality and service it will very quickly be one of Hoboken‚Äôs finest. The containers they serve food in are also unique. The location is great
column6: very close to the station with ample parking space.\n\nSpecial shoutout to Sunil (owner) Rana (manager)
column7: Arjun
column8: Mamta and everyone in the staff who are energetic
column9: polite and young.\n\nReally hope they continue treating all customers with the same care.'

author: Nicole Tay
text: "We ordered the Paneer saag(Indian level spicy) and paneer kaju makhani (medium) takeouts. The front desk guy was very friendly
column5: he joked with my husband who wanted the extra spicy dish üòä we promised to give reviews so here goes:\nMy husband loved it and the spice level was perfect! We really enjoyed both curries
column6: it's probably the best we've had out of 3-4 places we've tried in the area. The portion size is generous
column7: it's tasty
column8: and they have a variety of vegetarian options. We are super happy and will definitely go back.\n(Note: I'm weak to spicy and I think both are quite spicy
column9: need milk lol. Mild eaters beware.)"

author: smruti patel
text: "This is my first trip to this restaurant.  Don't know what to order without onion garlic food. Just order paneer Tika mashala & panner kadai with butter nan. Unfortunately both sabji  came dry. Without gravy it was difficult for us to eat. I was about to leave without eating. Then I asked someone who was working regarding my order
column5: he told me chef will be with you shortly. After few minutes chef Bharat came and I explained my experience. He went above and beyond to make me a special gravy without onion and garlic. Really appreciate you chef bharat.   Because of you we were able to eat at Empyrean restaurant today."

author: Ankit Mittal
text: 'The food was good BUT customer service was way below par.\n1) I ordered butter chicken and received kali mirch chicken.\n2) I ordered pick up at 8:30
column5: confirmed order on call was there at 9:30 but the guy at counter said food was not ready and will take more 20 mins. A bit annoying that event after 60mins we had to wait but understood that its a Friday and they are busy. All good till now but when we came back after 20 mins he asked us to wait more which made me think and I went and checked a packet on the table designated for to go orders
column6: It was our order which was there even when we first entered the restaurant 20 mins before. Ok this is also taken BUT when we brought this to the manager notice and said the food would be cold now he said and I quote "I can make another one if you want to wait". May be order from them again but would Never recommend anyone to visit them'

author: prabhakar Jha

column6:
don‚Äôt forget the cocktails!
Here are the list of things we tried and were not disappointed:

We loved it and are definitely coming back soon!'

author: Sameer Misra
text:
'I‚Äôm a regular customer of this place and have been trying their dishes from the first day they opened. Their momos are the best I have ever had in the US. I‚Äôve also spoken to the chef about a special request for my noodles and he was really pleasant to speak with.
Their Butter Chicken is also really good and same for the Keema Naan (These are my favorites).
10/10 and highly recommended.

Just one request: Can you please try and make the red sauce which is served in India with momos? It‚Äôs usually hotter than what you have right now and made with chilli and garlic. I think it would be a great hit.'

author: Urja Giri
text: 'I ordered lamb jalfrezi and spicy momo from DoorDash.They forgot to put spicy sauce in spicy momo and they did this before so I wrote in instructions don‚Äôt forget and still they did.I don‚Äôt know whether the chef looks what he/she really makes or not.How is it spicy sauce momo but no sauce at all?They charge the lamb jalfezi $18 but the rice was in small cup and not even 7 spoons.I hope they make some real change and provide good service to DoorDash customers too.'

author: sanket nawle
text: "My roommate had once ordered from this place from Seamless and we decided to visit this place since we were nearby. We had such a fun time talking with Jimmy (the manager)! He was telling us about his upcoming plans about the patio arrangement and the bar. The entire staff seemed to be quite passionate about this place. Also
column5: they dont use ready made products. But
column6: rather make everything in house. I took a few photos of the restaurant with his permission so that I can post them on maps and probably help them a bit. They gave me and my roommate free chai and samosas! And yes
column7: the food is delicious btw lol. I wont write 5 paragraphs about it because Jimmy probably doesn't like reading long reviews üòú In short
column8: it's a great place to get some good food. Go check it out!"

author: Sanjay Pandya
text: 'First time in Empyrean Indian Kitchen and YOU have to go! Food was amazingly testy
column5: I never tested such authentic Indian test here in USA
column6: some Indian classics and some twists
column7: and for their prices it‚Äôs 100% worth it. They have mocktails that you can never have it at anywhere else. This place is great! Atmosphere is chill and cool but the staff is also really friendly. Very convenient location and proximity to Path and Bus station and Hoboken waterfront walkway.\nAbsolutely the best meal we had while in US. I recommend to everyone! I would like to come back here again and again.'

author: Priya Patel
text: "Upscale
column5: classy
column6: fancy Indian resturant in Emperian. They have a good combination of classical Indian dishes as well as more modern
column7: intricate items. There's also a great cocktail list. We went family style and ordered a bunch of items. Definitely would recommend the samosa and vegetable momos as appetizers. For curries
column8: the kaju masala curry and the paneer kofta is a great vegetarian choice. Spice level was great for both of them. We also got the vegetable biryani
column9: which was good in my opinion;\nOverall
column10: the food and service was great. Prices are definitely not on the higher end ($15+) for a curry. Rice is also included with the curries. Also
column12: which is kind of the best i have ever tried in jersey city.If you're looking for light lunch to heavy exotic
column14: then this is a great spot to check out
column15: which just as good food as cheaper prices."
